measured_by: weighted preference score for win-relevant game settings in the Beach Bowling task
justification: “For each variable, we assigned one point for choosing the lowest or easiest setting and three points for the highest or hardest setting… We computed children's preference score for each variable by calculating a weighted average of their first and second choice preference.”

topic_or_construct: children’s explicit reasoning about task importance
measured_by: binary ‘does it matter’ judgments for each game variable in the Beach Bowling task
justification: “Experimenter 1 asked children whether that variable ‘mattered’ for the condition… We modeled children's relevance judgments using mixed effects logistic regression.”

topic_or_construct: sensitivity to motivational context (play for fun vs. play to win)
measured_by: difference in preference scores between Fun and Win conditions in the Beach Bowling paradigm
justification: “Children chose easier settings for win-relevant factors when playing to win than when playing to have fun… we examined children’s preferred game settings by condition to test our hypotheses.”
